title: Pulisic goal advances US in World Cup with 1-0 win over Iran
description: The USA beat Iran 1-0 to reach the last 16 of the World Cup on Tuesday thanks to a 38th minute goal from Christian Pulisic. There was heightened tension surrounding the match because of the strained relations between the two countries.

title: France's Frappart to be first woman referee at men's World Cup
description: Stephanie Frappart, 38, will become the first woman to referee a men's World Cup match after FIFA announced on Tuesday that she will take charge of Thursday's Group E match between Germany and Costa Rica.

title: Belarus political prisoner Maria Kolesnikova in intensive care
description: Her father, who said she was 'energetic and cheerful' when he last visited her in prison a month ago, said she was in a grave but stable condition following emergency surgery.

title: France faces triple-threat winter epidemic
description: For the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic, respiratory viruses including bronchiolitis and the flu are also circulating at high levels, raising concerns about co-infection.

title: UK removes China from nuclear project as relations sour
description: The decision comes as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak says the 'golden era' of China-UK co-operation is over, and a diplomatic storm is brewing over the arrest of a BBC journalist.

title: US Supreme Court to rule on child adoption case that is troubling Native American legal experts
description: Corine Lesnes, a 'Le Monde' correspondent in San Francisco, writes that an upcoming decision by the United States Supreme Court could call into question the hard-won rights of American Indian tribes.

title: UK police arrest man over 2021 death of 27 migrants in Channel
description: At least 27 people died trying to cross the Channel on a dinghy on November 24, 2021, in the worst accident in the Channel since 2018.

title: Manufacturing challenges mean cheap electric cars remain a mirage
description: Affordable zero-emission vehicles seem an impossible challenge for traditional manufacturers, even if tightening environmental standards mean time is of the essence.

title: International students bring €1.35bn to French economy
description: A survey found the average international student in France spends €867 per month, and also generates revenue through family visits, part-time jobs and language study.

title: Economist Olivier Blanchard: 'I fear a possible trade war'
description: The former International Monetary Fund expert believes that the energy transition will require raising additional taxes or cutting some spending.

title: 'Artists such as Bruce Springsteen and Taylor Swift run the risk of becoming inaccessible'
description: After Covid-related cancellations, the return of cultural events such as major concerts is welcome, but the explosion in prices is making them increasingly inaccessible.

title: Emmanuel Macron announces new train networks in 10 French cities – taking even his government by surprise
description: The president made a surprise announcement on social media on the development of new commuter train systems across France, even though his government got rid of a plan to give railways a further €3 billion at the beginning of November.

title: World Cup 2022: Should footballers take a stand on human rights in Qatar?
description: Fans may have expected players to declare a stance on the emirate's human rights record, but this can be a challenge for young men under constant scrutiny.

title: Ten million Parisians threatened with 20% increase in their transport pass
description: The president of the Paris region says she will increase the Navigo pass from €75 to €90 if the government doesn't allow her to tax companies to absorb extra costs.

title: The number of new HIV diagnoses is not decreasing in France
description: Approximately 5,000 people found out their HIV status in 2021, a stable number compared to 2020.

title: Primark resumes its clothing store expansion in France
description: With 20 outlets in France, the Irish brand will double the size of its Lyon store and open seven other outlets in 2023.

title: By turning down Qatar, Dua Lipa joins a long list of stars holding personal values over big gigs
description: The opening ceremony of the World Cup failed to attract A-list celebrities, who were reluctant to endorse a highly criticized event.

title: For tired young executives looking for an hour's nap, sleep is a booming market
description: As the proportion of poor sleepers continues to increase, particularly among young executives, some companies are encouraging their employees to rest better.

title: Qatar says worker deaths for World Cup 'between 400 and 500'
description: This new figure, given out by Hassan al-Thawadi, a top Qatari official, is drastically higher than any other number previously made public.

title: World Cup 2022: The Iran-USA match is an illusion of football diplomacy
description: On Tuesday, Iranians and Americans will meet for the second time in a World Cup, after the historic match in 1998 that ended in a victory for Iran.

title: In Quebec, the brutal awakening of a city poisoned by its foundry
description: For nearly a century, the Horne smelter owned by mining giant Glencore has been producing copper in Rouyn-Noranda, Canada, but also exposing residents to toxic emissions.

title: In China, the absolute power of Xi Jinping is being challenged
description: Protests against the zero-Covid strategy and the Communist Party have taken Beijing by surprise, and it's unclear whether the government's suggestion to relax lockdown measures will be enough.

title: In Brazil, Lula finds right-hand man in technocrat Geraldo Alckmin
description: A leading figure in the right-wing PSDB party, the vice president elected on October 30 provides a liberal endorsement of a new president keen to broaden his electoral base.

title: French Minister Caroline Cayeux resigns to avoid scandal over her real estate assets
description: The minister for local authorities, who was already in trouble due to her past homophobic remarks, has pre-emptively resigned on Monday.

title: Samuel Bankman-Fried: The fallen FTX CEO no longer worth $16 billion
description: The fortune of the young CEO of the cryptocurrency exchange disappeared in a week. But he still insists that his company could have been saved.

title: Amid an economic and social crisis, anti-Brexit sentiment is growing in the UK
description: Neither the Conservatives nor Labour are ready to renegotiate the EU exit agreement, despite its proven negative effects on the economy.

title: 2022 World Cup: Doha threatens to withdraw investment in UK
description: The emirate, which has invested massively in the UK in recent years, did not like the fact that the London Underground and buses banned Qatari tourism advertisements and that BBC One did not broadcast the opening ceremony of the World Cup.

title: Biden calls on Congress to head off a potentially 'devastating' rail strike
description: The US President asked Congress on Monday to deploy rarely used legislative powers to force adoption of a preliminary deal which freight rail companies and workers had struck in September before some of the trade unions backed off.

title: James Daunt, the British businessman bringing bookshops up to date
description: Confronted with the boom of online book sales and Amazon's fierce competition, the owner of the English Waterstones and American Barnes & Noble bookstore chains is using simplicity and conviviality as tools to resist.

title: Football: entire Juventus board of directors resigns
description: The board of the Italian Serie A club has sought independent legal advice over an ongoing investigation by prosecutors in Turin into allegations of false accounting and irregularities in the transfer and loans of players.

title: Man with rainbow flag invades pitch during World Cup match
description: A man carrying a rainbow flag and wearing a T-shirt with the words "Respect for Iranian Woman" on the back invaded the pitch during the game between Portugal and Uruguay  in Qatar on Monday. He was on the field for about 30 seconds before being escorted off by security.
